alert.note: Alert for Central Chippewa; Eastern Mackinac; Luce; Northern Schoolcraft; Southeast Chippewa; Southern Schoolcraft; Western Chippewa; Western Mackinac (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 18 at 5:05AM EDT until May 18 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...Red Flag Warning for this afternoon and evening for central and eastern Upper Michigan... .DISCUSSION...Temperatures warm into the 60s, possibly closer to the 70 degree mark in some spots. Critical relative humidity values and winds gusting as high as 30 to 40 mph will result in dangerous fire weather conditions this afternoon and evening across much of eastern and central Upper Michigan. The strongest wind gusts will be across eastern Upper Michigan. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR EASTERN UPPER MICHIGAN... The National Weather Service in Marquette has issued a Red Flag Warning FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, which is in effect from noon today to 8 PM EDT this evening. * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zone 007 Luce, Fire Weather Zone 014 Southern Schoolcraft, Fire Weather Zone 085 Northern Schoolcraft, Fire Weather Zone 086 Western Chippewa, Fire Weather Zone 087 Central Chippewa, Fire Weather Zone 088 Southeast Chippewa, Fire Weather Zone 095 Western Mackinac and Fire Weather Zone 096 Eastern Mackinac. * Winds...South 15 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 to 40 mph. * Relative Humidity...As low as 25 percent. * Temperatures...In the low to mid 60s. * Impacts...Burn restrictions are in effect. for more information on burn restrictions...visit the Michigan DNR website at http://www.michigan.gov/burnpermit...all lower case...or by calling 866-922-2876.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures and exceptionally dry fuels will create dangerous wildland fire conditions. Campfires, outdoor grills, smoking materials, chain saws, and all-terrain vehicles all have the potential to throw a spark and ignite a dangerous and destructive fire. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.
